title.rendered: “IDF Chief of Staff: Intensifying Pressure on Enemies Amid Ongoing Conflict”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

Chief of Staff in the North: When your enemy is struggling, don’t turn away, make it harder for them – we are making it harder.

The Chief of Staff held a situational assessment and a commanders’ discussion yesterday (Wednesday) at the Galilee Division on the Lebanon border, with the Northern Command Commander, Major General Uri Gordin, and the Galilee Division Commander, Brigadier General Shai Klafar.
Afterward, the Chief of Staff visited Metula and met with the council head, Mr. David Azoulay, and other representatives, where they discussed the situation and the importance of the IDF’s connection with the authorities and the residents.

Attached is a video of the Chief of Staff’s remarks: https://bit.ly/4cTCBcv

Attached is a video on the subject: https://bit.ly/4bBg3fr

Attached are pictures on the subject: https://idfanc.activetrail.biz/ANC7943437

Attached are the full remarks of the Chief of Staff: “When your enemy is struggling, don’t turn away, make it harder for them, make it harder for them. We are making it harder. Also to dismantle more, and we are making it harder to increase the chances of bringing back the hostages; this is a very significant matter. You see, I think that the assassinations are very important. I think they are very difficult for them. I believe that the command, the divisions, the whole system with the Air Force and the Military Intelligence are doing a very good job in locating the targets and attacking them. Maybe they are doing something good now, but the condition is that there is strong defense here.”
